qas.question: During the cold war, what European powers rebuilt their ecomonies?

answers.text: United Kingdom, France, and West Germany

qas.question: By what year was China beginning to lose its hold as sole legitimate government?
When did China lose its permanent seat at UN security council?

plausible_answers.text: Japan and the European powers of the United Kingdom, France, and West Germany

qas.question: What powers rebuilt their economies during 1949?
What two countries status as military powers was questioned?
When did West Germany lose its permanent UN security council seat?
After the cold war, which country began to lose its status as sole legitimate government?
What did China and Japan maintain to this day?

context: During the Cold War, the Asian power of <b3_0>Japan and the European powers of the <a0_0>United Kingdom, France, and West Germany<b3_0/><a0_0/> rebuilt their economies. France and the United Kingdom maintained technologically advanced armed forces with power projection capabilities and maintain <b7_0>large defence budgets<b7_0/> to this day. Yet, as the Cold War continued, authorities began to question if <b4_0>France and the United Kingdom<b4_0/> could retain their long-held statuses as great powers. China, with the world's largest population, has slowly risen to great power status, with large growth in economic and military power in the post-war period. After <a1_0>1949<a1_0/>, <b6_0>the Republic of China<b6_0/> began to lose its recognition as the sole legitimate government of China by the other great powers, in favour of the People's Republic of China. Subsequently, in <a2_0><b5_0>1971<b5_0/><a2_0/>, it lost its permanent seat at the UN Security Council to the People's Republic of China.
